name: tacking
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
long, loose stitches that are used to hold two pieces of cloth together temporarily before they are sewn together in a neater and permanent way: Remove the tacking. Suits are typically sold with tacking stitches holding the vent at the back of the jacket in place. See
tack
More examplesFewer examplesMachine the seam from the wrong side over the tacking.Then take out the tacking stitches and remove the card and you should have a really spectacular garment.She unfastened the tacking of one long satin sleeve of Flora's wedding gown and began to re-pin it.
